The driver was also very good and kind.Explained eFor the visitors who has short time I would recomend this plan.The driver who also explained everything was perfect.My husband and I want to thank "take tours,Hacienda Hotel and the drivers"

i think this was in a few movies... It is cool to see but not a lot to see. You can easily see it in a quick 20 - 30 min walk just down from the beach area. I liked it and glad I went to see it! Another FREE attraction.

column2: Our favorite part of Venice Beach
column3: This is a hidden jem in Venice beach. We didn't really care for Venice Beach in comparison to Santa Monica beach, it was dirty with lots of homeless people. The actual canals with the walkways and bridges was so beautiful, so much character and charm. I found it hard to believe it was Venice Beach. There were virtually no other tourists here so it must not be that well known, but we very much enjoyed it.

See how the other half lives -- literally! You get a ground-level view into the eclectic homes of these lucky residents of Venice. If you like architecture, art, and home decor, you'll really enjoy peaking into the yards and homes along the canals. Even if you don't, you'll be impressed by these homes. It doesn't take long to give yourself a little tour, so as long as you are going to Venice Beach, take 20 minutes or so to explore the canals.
One of the cleanest beaches with shopping around. more options of restaurants

My husband and I spent a romantic afternoon walking there during our honeymoon.Canals are beautiful and clean. They are similar to those in actual Venice but more modern.The houses facing the canals are very pretty and well kept.I suggest to all people who go to Los Angeles to visit this charming place. It is absolutely amazing.During the walk you can meet a lot of nice ducks and seagulls :-)
This was a surprise and so beautiful. I enjoyed seeing the homes along the canals and getting a sense of the lifestyles surrounding the canals. What a life!
It's fun to see an American take on the real Venice Canals, with colorful buildings and little bridges - interesting site to visit.
Hidden away a few blocks off the beach but worth the time. Facinating range of homes. Away from all the noise of LA. Take a stroll into a different world.

column2: take a break from high-priced, hectic SoCal theme parks
column3: The perfect outing for the solo traveler, couple, or family with a stroller---- who need a break from the frantic pace of other LA sights. Pass a QUIET hour walking along the canals, admiring the amazing homes up-close and watching ducks and sea birds frolic. End with delicious coffee or cold drink at The Cow's End on Washington Blvd. As a local, I enjoy this outing often.
Wow, forgot I was in LA for a little while. Very nice to walk around here and beautiful.
This is pure LA at it's finest. See if you can remember how many movies and TV shows shot here! It's a great afternoon combined with lunch in Venice. Tons of places to choose from.
took a mid morning stroll with my two children. All three of us enjoyed it very much.

The canals were dug out of a swamp almost 100 years ago and little bungalows were built here to stay while visiting the circus and pool in Venice. Most of the little bungalows have been replaced by 2-3 story modern homes. Still the canal walk is quiet and relaxing. The large public pool is long-gone but the circus atmosphere still remains on the Venice boardwalk. There are plenty of little restaurants in which to eat, some of them with hamburgers and hot dogs and some of them are quality restaurants with a nice menu and a good bar. The walk up to the boardwalk in only a short distance. Park in the public parking lot at the end of Washington Street and walk a block down to the canals.
Fun to wander around this small community full of (mainly) hippie-arty-types (no offense intended to anyone). Some good restos in the area as you wander.

We headed out hoping to find the elusive canals of Venice beach and just stumbled upon the Walkway. It was fun to see the canals with the different bridges and gorgeous homes. Definitely a good mix of locals jogging or walking the dogs and tourists ogling how the other half live.
Away from the hustle of Venice, and absolutely fun for the architecture and ambiance of the canals.

column2: Venice Canals Walkway, Los Angeles, CA
column3: Unique environment. Left over from developer Kinney's attempt to create the Venice canals in Los Angeles in early 20th century
Sit, relax have a drink and enjoy the people watching!

We've toured this area on bike and on Segway and there's always something interesting to see. The canals are a residential area, but all the houses are so interesting and different. There are houses that are beautifully maintained and well manicured to "kitchy" houses with skulls and dolls heads on the patios! Not your average "tourist" activity, but really a fun experience.
This is a very pretty walk along quiet canals and pretty homes.

column2: Very scenic but walk around Venice...
column3: Another iconic LA site to visit. I walked around but felt that I am intruding someone's space...the houses are literally a doorstep away.I walked around the Venice Beach area as well and some of the houses are very great. Small yet charming. I wanted to take some pictures but almost everywhere I go, I see a sign "Neighborhood Watch"...
great to walk around and try and remember all the movies that have filmed there. very interesting hearing the history of it too
awesome walk, had a few people trying to get us to buy cd's but other than that, stunning walk!

column2: not like the real Venice, but ok
column3: when having enough time, its interesting to see, but its far from the real, italian Venice...not really amazing, but good for a walk and relaxing from the busy LA life
Peaceful to walk around and so many beautiful houses!
So many fabulous homes! A nice place to go for a walk :-)

accidently stumbled on the canals - some beautiful gardens and houses and canals. A wonderful walk through the maze of the canals. Venice beach can be a lot to take in but the canals offer a welcome break. So pleased we accidently found them. We looked to be the only people walking through them, but I can imagine they, like most things, get a lot busier in summer and lose some of beauty in the buzz of people.
Even most L.A. folks haven't been here. It is rare and special!

column2: Worth checking out, but only if you have time
column3: A beautiful and peaceful part of Venice Beach. Definitely worth a walk through to check it out. We spent about 30 mins here and felt that was all that we needed. It was however enough time to develop jealous feelings for the lucky few who get to live there.
i had no clue vencice ebach had canals like in italy. i think it is worth a day trip

column2: Venice Canals - Go and see the real thing!
column3: I really cannot see that this is worth a look unless you have wandered into Venice Beach, a mistake, and happen to see it on the way out! Now Venice Italy, those are canals!

It is a quiet and beautiful part of Venice...the complete opposite of the crazy and dirty boardwalk. A callback to the days when Abbott Kinney envisioned an Italian-like equivalent complete with canals and gondolas and a piece of history not usually associated with Los Angeles.
It feels like I've left Los Angeles and entered paradise

I found out about the canals of Venice Beach thanks to my friend who insisted we saw them. I had been to Venice several time, and never realized there were there. Indeed there are slightly tucked away inland a street or 2 away from the Beach. But once you see it, you will realize it is worth the detour. You walk around canals and bridges and see wonderful houses with their private gardens everywhere. This is a very refreshing after a car-packed visit to Downtown or Hollywood Bd!

beautiful quiet stroll after the madness that is Venice Beach - all sorts of different house styles - we liked the original old houses the best - it was decorated for xmas when we went and that was lovely to see, all the bridges were lit, can't imagine living there though as it must be like living in a fish bowl!
during day time, it is good beach but there are some scary people in night.
We loved this walk more than the boardwalk! Beautiful at night for a romantic walk.

column2: Pleasant walk, be careful of pick pockets
column3: Nice place but the crowd is complicated, so just be careful of your belongings and you'll have a good time!

column2: Venice Canals In Los Angeles, CA
column3: Great walk and awesome scenery. Right behind Venice Beach you can find the Venice Canals. Unlike the unusual suspects you find @ Venice Beach, these canals are refreshing an worth the time to walk and soak up California sun!

We loved the canals, they are so well kept, so beautiful and a relaxed area to spend some time walking through. The little bridges are cute, you can go by car of course but iit is nicer to walk through the area because the canals and the houses and gardens are very attractive and you would miss a lot if you don't get out of the car. I highly recommend a visit to this area.

column2: Great walk on a sunny day
column3: The walkway runs along the famous Venice canals. Lots of beautiful houses (my favorites are the small cottages, which are the original buildings of the area). Quaint bridges. The only thing missing are gondolas! But you should see plenty of kayaks and stand-up paddle boarders while you stroll. Note: The walkway is narrow. It is not suitable for strollers (you'll be in the way of other walkers) and bikes are not allowed.
An evening stroll along the canal banks is a special experience.
I hadn't been to the canals on my previous visit as they were out of the way, but this time we made sure to go there. It was a beautiful and relaxing experience, highly recommended!

column2: After a noisy walk on the pier, the canal walk is welcomed
column3: Very interesting walk and very quiet compared to the noisy beach and pier.
It was a lovely view with the canals in front of the houses. Doesn't consume much time to visit this place.

first, I saw this in September 2010. Panorama setting on camera is a must. Homes are bright and colorful. Saw a few other walkers and they were smiling. Ducks were nice. It did have a smell. Nice walk. Thought about bringing flowers. (Think Valentines Day movie, Ashton Kutcher)

I really wanted to see the canals, and I had lost my map, so it took us a lot of wandering around the streets of Venice to work out how to find them and actually get in there, but it was worth it!Many people don't know about this sweet little part of LA, which I find amazing. I would LOVE to live in one of the houses on the canals, and I just loved wandering around and across the bridges.Very interesting and something a bit different!

This is a lovely area, totally worth visiting. Venice Beach is a very interesting neighborhood, with a variety of things to see and to do. The canals are nicely manicured with beautiful houses all around, which make this a must see when visiting LA.

My wife and I loved strolling around this area after seeing Venice Beach. Each house is different and eclectic. This is such a lovely scenery to walk around in. A total different side of the Venice area.

Charming place with a very unique character! Not for a moment you feel that you're in Venice, Italy, but that's not even the meaning. I'm so happy that they didn't fill all the canals in the 1920's. Absolutely worth for a walk!
.... very soothing atmossphere, a throw-back to calmer times.

column2: Beautiful View of Venice Beach Homes
column3: We came upon this little enclave quite by accident. A stroll down the walkway was delightful. Unfortunately, not all that walk their dogs there are scrupulous about cleaning up. A small price to pay for the lovely views, and a walk that is good for the soul.
You should not miss it! awesome walkway beautiful houses, great place for a few pics.
You can walk along the canals for exercise and look at the cute homes!

column2: A Taste of old Venice, almost gone.
column3: Loved seeing the varieties of architecture, landscaping and patio design.

column2: A lovely old neighborhood with canals
column3: This is a lovely part of Los Angeles history. The neighborhood is connected by a series of canals and pretty bridges. There is no place to park once you are there so find something on the adjacent streets and walk in. You really need to walk it to appreciate the ambiance. There are lots of neat houses and the walkways and bridges are just charming. People were friendly and didn't seem to mind us strolling through and checking out their digs.
So many wonderful places to walk and so much to see. We love Venice, it's quirky and fun with lots to experience.
Reminded me of some Europeen places... but smaller.

column2: A peaceful escape from the craziness of Ocean Ave
column3: The stroll along the canals was a nice change from the hectic noise along the beach. Other tourists were generally very respectful that you are walking among people's homes and the home owners styles in decor adds to the interest.

My mom and I have visited every December to enjoy the elaborately decorated homes near Carroll & Linnie Canals. There are two homes that go all out with their decor & lights. It's a great time to take pictures with your family if you are not into elaborate Holiday decorating.
I dislike nothing. I like it all: the little sidewalks, the trees, flowers, patios with tables and chairs, the dogs, the sunshine, the individuality of each well loved home.
liked the setting but it is only one street away from the broadwalk which is a bit tatty and druggy
The Venice Canal was really beautiful. Nice neighborhood and houses. Enjoy your peaceful stroll here.
Been to Venice a couple of times and never knew this existed. It is lovely and worth the visit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Awesome time; great scenery and met lots of interesting people!
Take a wonderful stroll through the Venice Canals and admire all the funky/unique houses in the area. This is a great area to just relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Highly recommended.
Really peaceful place to take a stroll and look at some beautiful houses.

column2: Take your time and enjoy the sights
column3: Great little adventure here lots to buy and see.. I am glad i decided to buy from here rather than santa monica pier.. venice is much cheaper and have more variety.. had a great time here

Many people look at the local map and see the canals but tend to ignore them as they focus on the beach front and other chic streets. If you enjoy a quiet setting with lovely clean waterways surrounded by small but colourful homes and nice gardens then this is a must for an hour leisurely stroll.

column2: Beautiful place where to walk and relax
column3: If, like me, you are tired of crowded and noisy Venice beach, do not hesitate. It's only 2 block away from the southern beach walk. There are signs posted to get there. A real paradise with very nice houses and beautiful small gardens. I just feel a bit annoyed for people living there with all day tourists looking in their gardens and houses. As I read a lot of canals were destroyed decades ago and only a few of them were saved from destruction thanks to citizens associations. A must see.

First impressions of Venice Beach were not great as it all seemed a bit seedy, but we found the canals walkway and that all changed. Tranquil walk with a good path and bridges over several areas of canal right outside the yards of the local residences which are very interesting and varied in design. Definitely worth visiting.

Only a few blocks away from the famous Venice Beach, this is a nice walk which should be on everyone's vacation checklist. Beautiful architectural homes line the shallow water ways with arched pedestrian bridges make for a lovely photo-op.

Everyone goes to the Venice Boardwalk (very fun!) but this is just 2 blocks away and just beautiful. After the intereesting but crowded boardwalk, you should really stroll thru the canals and look at the beautiful homes there. You will be sorry if you miss it.

Went for a walk here early one morning was lucky to find free street parking nearby the start of the walk. Was great to see the canals and cute Bridges. Must be annoying for residents having tourists wander by their homes, path is literally on their doorsteps. But maybe the residents are as laid back as the rest if Venice!We took the signposted path from the canal down to beach then. Worth a visit

column2: Beautiful area, a real shocking find...
column3: Beautiful area, a real shocking find after walking from Santa Monica pier and through Venice beach!! Really nice to walk around and over the quaint bridges. Great oppurtunity for nice photo's.

column2: Grab a Great Cup of Coffee and Take a walk thru the Venice Canals
column3: I love gardens, walking, history and coffee. The Venice Canal Walkways allowed me to indulge in all of these. I never knew about the canals until a few years ago when I read a newspaper article about them-suddenly I understood why the city is named Venice. The canals are not huge and appear to be about 3 feet deep. The day I went to see them, you could see fish and small crabs that must have washed in when they change the water. I far more enjoyed walking thru the canal walkways than on the Venice Beach walk (although everyone should see that too). It is very interesting that the homes are a mixture of small quaint original bungalows mixed with bungalows that have "grown" into large 2 story homes. The Venetian theme is also apparent on Venice Beach where several orginal buildings have Venetian type columns and windows. I suggest before you stroll thru the canal walkways that you stop and get a coffee. I did what I usually do and asked a local for a coffee recommendation. She recommended the Cow's End on Washington Blvd. It was obviously a local's place and was packed( however there was a Starbucks 1 block up. ) We grabbed a delicious Americano and had a wonderful morning stroll thru the Venice Canal Walkways
